column4: every once in a while the battery icon shows up on my notification area and tells me my laptop battery is very low and charging.. however, if I unplug power and plug it back again, it says it's fully charged.  if I type acpi -b at prompt it shows me my battery is fully charged.  Anyone know what's going on?
Software coders have been bad at writing 64bit stuff since as long as I can remember
hmm not finding them any worse from my experience.. but I look forward to finding crappy 64bit stuff :)
it just doesn't make sense for most people
know of any bug with the battery applet in gnome?
I don't understand why this applet thinks my battery is depleted but charging when acpid -b shows fully charged .. is this something I should worry bout?
no, i'm just wondering if the kernel thinks there is more than one BATX dir
ack .. there is nothing writted in BAT0
yes .. however.. nothing is noted under alarm, info or state
